criteria: Selection and Proper Use of Protective Gear
Awareness of Risks and Safety Procedures
descriptions: Student does not identify or use any protective gear or equipment.
Student identifies some protective gear but does not use it or uses it incorrectly.
Student identifies and attempts to use protective gear, but demonstrates significant errors in usage.
Student generally selects and uses appropriate protective gear and equipment but may have minor errors or omissions.
Student consistently selects and correctly uses appropriate protective gear and equipment with only minor oversights.
Student expertly selects and uses all appropriate protective gear and equipment, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of safety protocols.
Student demonstrates no awareness of potential risks or safety procedures.
Student shows minimal awareness of risks and safety procedures, unable to articulate or apply them.
Student acknowledges some risks and safety procedures but struggles to apply them effectively.
Student demonstrates a general awareness of risks and safety procedures, applying them with some consistency.
Student consistently demonstrates a strong awareness of risks and safety procedures, applying them effectively in most situations.
Student comprehensively understands risks and safety procedures, proactively applies them, and can explain the rationale behind them.
Student shows no understanding of proper equipment maintenance or storage.
Student demonstrates a limited understanding of maintenance and storage, with no practical application.
Student attempts basic maintenance and storage but makes significant errors.
Student generally maintains and stores equipment properly, with some minor oversights.
Student consistently maintains and stores equipment according to guidelines, ensuring its longevity and safety.
Student expertly maintains and stores equipment, demonstrating a deep understanding of its care and contributing to a safe environment for all.
